# INTemporalEventTrigger

**Class**

A trigger condition based on a date or time.

## Declaration

```swift
class INTemporalEventTrigger
```

## Overview

When configuring tasks, you can add an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INTemporalEventTrigger] object to display a reminder at a specific time. Because you specify the time values using an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INDateComponentsRange] object, the trigger condition can occur at a single time or within a range of time. You can also specify a repeating trigger time by specifying a day without a month or year or by specifying a time value without a specific day.

## Initializing an Event Trigger

- **init(dateComponentsRange:)**: Initializes the event trigger with the specified date information.

## Getting the Trigger Condition

- **dateComponentsRange**: The triggering time range for an event.

## Event Triggers

- **INSpatialEventTrigger**: A trigger condition based on the user’s arrival or departure from a given location.
- **INTemporalEventTriggerTypeOptionsResolutionResult**: A resolution result that adds a temporal event trigger.
- **INDayOfWeekOptions**: Days of the week.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
